meanings.definition: A stone that forms part of a corner in a building.
meanings.sent1: The perpent was carefully placed to support the corner of the house.
meanings.sent2: The mason used perpents to create a sturdy foundation for the building.
meanings.sent3: The perpent in the wall seemed to be winking at me, as if it had a secret.
meanings.sent4: The perpent stood tall and strong, like a guardian protecting the building.
meanings.sent5: I will always remember the perpent as the cornerstone of the structure.

meanings.definition: To build or form with perpents.
meanings.sent1: The workers perpented the walls with precision and care.
meanings.sent2: It is important to perpent the corners correctly for a stable construction.
meanings.sent3: The team decided to perpent the new house in record time, impressing everyone.
meanings.sent4: She perpented her dreams with determination and hard work.
meanings.sent5: Perpenting the project together, they created something truly remarkable.

meanings.sent1: The perpent between the bricks allowed for proper ventilation.
meanings.sent2: The mason filled the perpent with mortar to strengthen the structure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the perpent as a hiding spot for its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The perpent seemed to divide the wall like a silent observer.
meanings.sent5: I could feel the cool breeze coming through the perpent on a hot day.
